For questions 1 - 5, use the the three exponential functions defined below:

  • \(f(x)=100 \cdot 3^x\)
  • \(g(x)=100 \cdot (3.5)^x\)
  • \(h(x)=100 \cdot 4^x\)
  1. Which of these functions grows the least quickly? 

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.2.

The correct answer is \(f(x)\). The value of \(f\) triples each time \(x\) increases by 1 because the growth factor (or the base) is 3.

    1. Which function grows the most quickly?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.2.

The correct answer is \(h(x)\). The value of \(h\) quadruples each time \(x\) increases by 1 because the growth factor (or the base) is 4.

    The three given graphs represent the functions \(f\), \(g\), and \(h\) defined above.




    1. Which graph corresponds to \(f(x)\)?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.2.

The correct answer is Graph C.

  1. Which graph corresponds to \(g(x)\)?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.2.

The correct answer is Graph B.

  1. Which graph corresponds to \(h(x)\)?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.2.

The correct answer is Graph A.

The correct answer is Graph M.

For questions 9 - 10, use the graph below.


    1. Written in the form \(f(x)=a \cdot b^x\), what is the value of \(a\) for each function?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.3.

The correct answer is 160.

    1. Which graph decreases the most quickly?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.3.

The correct answer is Graph C.

The graphs of \(y=50 \cdot 2^x\), \(y=200 \cdot 2^x\), and \(y=100 \cdot 2^x\) are shown.



  1. Which is the graph of \(y=100 \cdot 2^x\)?

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 5.12.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Graph B.

For questions 12–14, use the graph below:

  1. Which of the functions graphed, \(y=a \cdot b^x\), has the smallest value for \(a\)?

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 5.12.3–5.12.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is F. Since F has the lowest \(y\)-intercept, it has the smallest value of \(a\).

  1. Which of the functions graphed, \(y=a \cdot b^x\), has the lowest value for \(b\)?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.2.

The correct answer is C. Since C is decaying the fastest, it has the lowest value for \(b\).

  1. What is the equation of the horizontal asymptote for \(f(x)=5 \cdot 2^x-3\)?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.12.2.

The correct answer is \(y= -3\). The –3 in the function shifts the exponential down 3.
